text: Salty and delicious. That is what they promise and deliver. Nice lasting head. Aroma has lots of lime. Flavor is salty with lime and sweetness. It all works great together. ITs a great addition to the best gose in the country IMO. Very full body. AWESOME AND AMAZING! Its hard to beat a Gose for low gravity beers.

From tap. Pours hazy straw with a thin white head. Lots of lime on the nose, plus grass and sourdough. Delicious tart lime flavors, a hint of sweetness, salty-sour fruit, lively carbonation. Refreshing and well balanced. Leaves you thirsty for another one.

Purchased May 2017 in Washington DC but drank in U.K. In June. Substantial aroma of lime. Tart acidic. Overpowering lime character 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12oz can from whole foods in greenville, sc: murky gold, thin white head. aroma of salt, lime, herbal. tastes sharp and even tart, lime, basil, acidic, grassy, yogurt, zesty, sea salt. delicious. to my tastes.
12 oz can shared by jc1762, thanks Jon! Hazy yellow with off-white head. Aromas of lime, tart notes. Tastes of tart limes, salt. Light body with a dry finish.

Can from Finger Lakes Beverage. Pours golden with a thin white head. Leaves some lacing in the glass. Lovely lime and tart notes on the nose. Lots of lime and salt on the tongue. Finished clean. Nice.
A whole bunch of limes were sacrificed in the crafting of this beer, which is at once good and tasty and also sorta boring in comparison to the regular WB gose.

12oz can. Small off-white head atop lightly hazed straw body. Aroma is moderately sweet, lime, some salt, lemon. Taste is medium sweet, lemon, some lime, light salt. Light body, light acidity, low carbonation.

[9107-20170330] 473mL can. Lime ginger citrus zest aroma. Slightly hazy, orange tan body with a quick foamy white head. Lime citrus zest and ginger spice flavour with a toasted seed finish. Medium body. Really odd. (5/3/5/2/10) 2.5
(c/o IPFreely, w/ jercraigs)
DoesnÂ’t come together very well. Some biscuit and spur lime. Pours golden with ok head. Tangy finish. A mess like the inlaws made the key lime pie and you told them how you feel. Tap at Churchkey.
Their regular gose is brilliant, but this beer just tastes like key lime pie, and I hate key lime pie. Not good.

Can poured into a stange, the appearance was simple hazy orange color. Slight little lace after a quickly moving little white foamy head obliterated itself as a usual gose.
The aroma had sweet and tart lime up front, some mineral notes, sour-ed wheat, pie crust/biscuits.
The flavor leaned to the tart side initially with a decent little wheat bite developing and letting in some of that pie crust/biscuit-like quality that I first smelled. Light aftertaste of the lime and that pie crust/biscuits. No finish.
The feel was light bodied with a fair sessionability about it. Carbonation felt fine. ABV felt appropriate. 
Overall, I can see this still being a gose. I treated it like one hence the glassware. Also dig the Westbrook creativity in this one. WouldnÂ’t mind more cans to crush during the Summer.

12 oz. can. Hazy orange. Smells very limey, wheat, mineral, something like pie crust. Tastes tart and intensely limey. Wheat. More lime. ItÂ’s all lime. Light, and while itÂ’s really limey, itÂ’s not that sour. Pleasant tartness. Nice.

0,355l can from Uba ja Humal, shared with wiosna @ home. Pours hazy yellow with a low head. Aroma is sweet and salty lime with tart malts. Flavor is sour malts with some sweet notes, salt and lime. Great.

Thanks Jay for the can! Poured into a snifter showing moderately filtered darker orange with half a finger of clean white foam. 

The nose shows intense tart notes of lime. 

The palate is medium bodied and well carbonated. Intensely tart with flavors of key lime. Very light saltiness on the palate to balance it out but not really enough. Somehow shouldnÂ’t work, but it does.

Drunk from can. Sharp citrussy, lime zesty nose, bland wheatyness, light tart. Med liight bodied. Tarty. Limey, sharp, pretty intense, longish finish. Gets intenser as warms up a little. Really good clean intense tart limey, refreshing.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

12 oz. can from State Of Beer, Raleigh. Hazy yellowish-orange pour with a frothy white head. Aroma of lime zest and faint yeast. Unmistakable lime taste with just a hint of saltiness on the finish. Also some noted green apple and white wine notes. Everything thatÂ’s great about WestbrookÂ’s standard gose but with lime replacing lemon. Top of its class.
Pours a cloudy, pale yellow. Nice key lime nose. Quite tart. Key lime appears early. Finishes mildly salty. Key lime reappears following the finish.

12 ounce can into tulip glass, canned on 3/30/2017. Pours hazy golden yellow/light orange color with a 2 finger fairly dense and fluffy white head with good retention, that reduces to thin lace cap that lingers. Slight spotty lacing clings on the glass. Aromas of big tart/sour lemon, lime juice/zest, grapefruit, pear, green apple, white grape, coriander, sea salt, wheat, graham cracker, herbal, floral, light pepper/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of fruity/acidic yeast, limes, coriander, sea salt, and light-moderate pale malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big tart/sour lemon, lime juice/zest, grapefruit, pear, green apple, white grape, coriander, sea salt, wheat, graham cracker, herbal, floral, light pepper/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness. Moderate fruity/lactic sourness and light spiciness on the finish. Lingering notes of sour lemon, lime juice/zest, grapefruit, pear, green apple, white grape, coriander, sea salt, wheat, graham cracker, light herbal, floral, light pepper/lacto funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a while. Fantastic complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/acidic yeast, limes, coriander, sea salt, and light-moderate pale malt flavors; with a nice malt/sourness balance; lightly puckering, but not astringent after the finish. Moderate dryness from tart/sourness, increasing through the glass. Medium carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, moderately crisp/acidic/saline, and fairly creamy/grainy balanced mouthfeel that is great. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 4%. Overall this is a fantastic fruited gose! All around outstanding complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/acidic yeast, limes, coriander, sea salt, and light-moderate pale malt flavors; very smooth, crisp, and refreshing to drink; despite the fairly strong lactic acidity/drying finish. Huge on limes, but still has an awesome balance with the base beer. A highly enjoyable offering.

Slightly hazy straw color with a bit of off-white foam. Aroma has tart lemon and lime with some spicy notes on top. Taste is tart and lemony with light nutmeg and cinnamon notes. Dry, tart and spicy. Light body, medium carbonation. Overall itÂ’s a really nice, flavorful and refreshing gose.
Best boat beer ever made. Sour and salty. Super refreshing and not overly limey.
One day old can from WB. Poured light haze with white head. Aroma nice lime salt. Light carb med bod. Taste tart key lime little salty slight cream. Pretty good stuff

2017-03-30. Golden body, small quick beige head. Lightly funky sour gose aroma, with a vegetal character not quite like cucumber skins, lime peel. Flavour is moderately sour throughout, lime, and a hint of cucumber skin again? Lightly salty undertones. Average bodied palate, soft carbonation. Enjoyable. 7/3/7/3/15+ Can courtesy of ipfreely.
Clouded yellow color. Fresh aroma of lime, other citrus and lemon. Nice salty taste with lime and ginger, juicy.

Can 355ml @ ParentÂ’s place
Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, lime, citrus and tart. Taste is light sweet and medium to heavy sour with a long dry, tart, lime and citrus finish. Body is light, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.

9/20 can't say I enjoyed it but I did enjoy the novelty. Strong on the line and not overly sour, pretty tart and citrussy. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Perfect Gose! Honestly, this blew my mind. IÂ’m reviewing this from memory so dont expect lots of details but while I was drinking it I remember thinking that this is just pure perfection. A sweet lime nose, and just as tart as needed, I think i could pretty much drink the whole production by myself
i wanted to love this so much as it is my favorite style, but it tasted like floor cleaner. couldnt finish it. so disappointing.
33cl can. Clear golden with a small white head. Lime, hoppy and yeasty. Salty light tart. Nice.

Limonka power. Bardzo przyjemny aromat. Do tego dochodzÄ… zioÅ‚a. OrzeÅºwiajÄ…co kwaÅ›ne. Jakbym piÅ‚ sok ze Å›wieÅ¼o wyciÅ›niÄ™tej limonki z dodatkiem ziÃ³Å‚. Na jÄ™zyku pozostaje przyjemna kwaÅ›noÅ›Ä‡ oraz sÅ‚onoÅ›Ä‡. Nie odpycha, a wrÄ™cz sprawia, Å¼e chce siÄ™ wziÄ…Ä‡ nastÄ™pnego Å‚yka. Nagazowanie jest doÅ›Ä‡ wysokie, ale nie przeszkadza. Bardziej przeszkadza bekanie po kilku Å‚ykach. Po ogrzaniu wychodzi delikatne ciasteczka i dopiero robi siÄ™ przyjemnie.

Keg Third of a Pint at Craft 100 Festival at Craft Beer Co, Clapham, London in Oct 2016 - Cloudy Yellow in colour. Large white head. Excellent lacing. Prickly carbonation. Very Fruity; citrus lime. Malty; wheaty malts. Spicy; coriander. Sour, tart, very fruity, salty. Very refreshing. Lovely fruity Gose! (2016-10-06)

Can at Uncle BabeÂ’s in Gent shared by Ster, thanks! Thin, egg-white, loose and quickly thinning head, hazy gold colour with greenish hue. Aroma of lime juice, sour yoghurt, sourdough, lemon candy or even lemon-scented soap, green olive, sea salt, fresh orange peel, white bread, limoncello, starfruit. Crisp, souring onset but not overly puckering, sharpish tingling carbonation, lots of green berry and lemon sourness pleasantly and refreshingly balanced with starfruit and orange sweetishness and, of course, a dried seaweed-like, soft saltiness as is to be expected from a Gose; supple mouthfeel, still a tad overcarbonated but in this case only accentuating the refreshing qualities of this beer, light bready backbone, drying lemony acidity in the finish with subtle traces of sweetness Ã  la limoncello and mojito. Very crisp, fruity elaboration on the Westbrook Gose standard, lemon pie-like in its combination of crisp sourness and subtle fruit sweetness, the latter just big enough to create a balancing factor against the sourness and the saltiness. Well crafted, interesting and appetizing.

Yellow, small head. From lime and lemon, mint, cocktail like, but with pale malts. Light and refreshing. Taste is a bit watery, even at the low abv. And more simple, lemony than the aroma. Decent brew. (33cl can at Uncle BabeÂ’s Gent)

Can at home. Pours a clear light yellow with a fluffy, large white head which lingers for a while. Aroma is lime, cookie dough and salt. Taste is lime tart, medium saltiness, sweet/sour lime syrup, grapefruit citrus bitterness.

Sample at Kurtkeller 025: Eclipse-tastic 01 on 12/23/2016. Slightly hazy pale yellow color with a thin white head that evaporates steadily to an outer ring. Short strings of lacing. Lime, yeast and malt in the nose. Light-bodied with flavors of tart lime, salt, biscuit malt and a pinch of spice. The finish is mildly tart with a citrusy lime aftertaste. Above average overall.
Can at bens... Hazy amber... Thin white lacing.. Soft funk nose.. Big tart fruits.. Massive lime.. Soft sharp funk fruit.... Massive lime
Can. Pours straw yellow. Aroma of lime, biscuit and salt. Taste has buttery biscuit and salty lime. Margarita esk. Nice and tart.

Backlog. Synchronizing with notes and Untappd.
Westbrook tap takeover @Chmielarnia MarszaÅ‚kowska Warszawa 
Salty, crisp and refreshing with a huge lime presence. Mid low carbonation
12oz can from can from ValhallaÂ’s Goat. Very pale yellow, good head. Lime cordial aroma. It does taste like key lime pie but I am not sure that is a good thing.

Can 12fl.oz. [ As Westbrook Key Lime Pie Gose ].Clear medium to light yellow color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is light to moderate malty, pale malt, moderate to light heavy citrus - lime - lemon. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet with a long to average duration, candy, zesty, lime, tart, sweet malt, light pale malt. Body is medium, texture is watery to oily, carbonation is soft. Quit refreshing. [20161112]
 7-3-8-3-15

0,355l can at home from Beergonzo. Some date on the can says 07/15/2016 which I hope means canned. dark yellow cloudy color, small white head. smells of thyme, oregano, lightly citric, rather unique smell. light body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes citric, sprite like, thyme, light oregano. finishes medium sour with notes of thyme and citrus. quite refreshing actually I rather like it.

355 ml can @ Himmeriget, Copenhagen. Clear golden with a tiny white head that disappears immediately. Fruity, spicy, lemon and something strange in aroma. Flavor is quite refreshing at the first sips, but feels a bit artificial lime after a while. Light salt and some unbalanced spices here. Medium body and average aftertaste. Not a big fan.
A decent gose, but is a by too well balanced, I prefer a more aggressive salt/ sour kick .

12 oz can. Canned 08/2016. Thanks Timothy A!
Clear champagne color with no head.
Soap, lime juice and mild spices in the aroma. Reminds of tequila. The flavor is lime, salt, tartness, lime juice and spices. More lime, salt and tourist tequila than key lime pie. 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can 0,33.
Light yellow color. Aroma: lots of lemon, also spicy notes. Taste: very sour, lemon dominates, spices, cookies, long sour finish.

Can at home picked up from Bottle shop. A light hazed yellow straw coloured pour with a big white head that fades. Aroma is initially really sharp zesty lime, salt, crisp grains, kaffir lime, lemon rind. Flavour is composed of really sharp tart citrus fruits, lime and lemon, zesty lime, pinch of salt, light grains a little straw. Palate is sharp citric acid, high spritzy carbonation, uber dry finish. Good stuff. It doesnÂ’t come across as soapy which is really good.

I was not impressed. I am not a big fan of this style so I guess my rating is biased. I don't think the lime goes with the saltiness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft at Kanaal in Sofia. Hazy yellow color with a large white head. Aroma is loads of lime, graham crackers, honey, salt. Flavor is dry and tart. Lots of lime, but not the same Mr. Clean many beers like this have. Medium-light body with a great crispness. Very legit.

Can. Creamy White good mostly deminishing head. Yellow colour. Light malty and moderate hoppy citrus aroma. More like radler than beer. Light biter slightly acetiv artificial lime flavor. Gose-notes very hidden. Average finish. Oily palate and too fizzy. very disapointing brew.
Bottle @Ulfborg Scooper. Clear light golden, white head. Lime pie aroma. Salty lime flavour, juicy, dry.
Can, 4%. Clear pale yellow with small white head. Aroma is malt, lemon, spices and lime. Flavour is malt, lemon, lime, spices, little sweet, little dry, little salt,

Can @ fonefan tasting. Clear yellow iwth a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, herbal, lemon and light tart. Flavor is medium sweet and light acidic. Dry and light acidic finish with a little salt. 121116

Pours a hazy light orange with small white head that dissipates quickly. Really smells like key lime pie. Taste: Lemon & lime tartness with salt, citric lactose, apples, wheat but no pie. Very refreshing and drinkable with long lingering sour finish, v.nice!

Can @deTolly, Tartu. Pours yellow with minimum white head. Aroma: sourish, seasalt, really there is a lime pie, a bit curds, something sweet and creamy. Taste: sour, salty, raw apples, citrus juice, lemon peal bitterness. Thin plus body. Long sour citric finish. Nice.

355 ml. can @ Uncle BabeÂ’s Burger Bar. Pricey affair but I enjoyed it a lot. Canned 07/15/2016. Lightly hazy golden, little white head. Nose is awesome sour lemon, lemonade, pleasantly salty, low cocktail feel. Taste is basic sour lemonade, pleasant salt, very basic lacto, lime, lemon, sparkling, basic super refreshing lime & lemon lemonade, lightly salty, perfect, low cocktail. Really good, zero complexity but highly delicious. I should hate but I adore it. Sue me, way better than the base. This is fancy lemonade in the best way imaginable, insanely drinkable.

355ml can (Uba ja Humal)
Bit of a gusher. Hazy yellow, fizzy head. Stinky aroma when pouring, citrus and spices. Baked apple with cinamon in the glass. Sharp lacto palate, otherwise a bit watery. Pie spices in the taste too, cheap lime cordial, watery, touch of salt. Finish is cinamon. Load of rubbish.

Can (from UJH). Street tick, so looks like a can. Aroma is citrus and lacto with hint of salt. Flavor is sour, salty and some sweetness, lacto, citrus, lemon. Finish is also lacto sour. Overall: drinkable.

330ml can (thanks Mart). Straight from the can as street tick. DidnÂ’t even bother to peek how it looks so Appearance nr is random. Acidic, salty, sour, citrus and lactic in aroma. Cinnamon, sour, acidic, wheaty in taste. Short cinnamon with bunch of citric acidity in aftertaste. Crisp carbonation. Drinkable brew.

Can 35,5 cl. Pours yellow with a slight haze and a tiny, white head. Very tart lemon aroma. Light body, lowish carbonation, very tart lemon/lime accents - and nothing much else really. No beer character whatsoever, very refreshing as such, but you could as well be drinking watered down lemon juice. 261016

6th October 2016Craft 100. Clapham. Keg. Very hazy gold beer, good white head. Palate is airy and semi dry, decent fine carbonation. Light malts. Good lime sherbet, touch of lemon. Very light savoury vibe. Light limey finish. Bright, breezy and refreshing.

Pours a hazy dull pale honey color with a thin white head. Aroma has bright, almost sweet lime with with underlying hints of lemony tartness and salinity. Flavor definitely has a lemony tartness up front and at the finish with a notable fruity lime, light grains, and a touch of salt in the middle....a bit of gingery spice that is suoer faint. Mouthfeel is light and the finish is tart, lactic and lemony.

UPDATED: OCT 23, 2016 From can. Is not a pie. Smells a bit like it though. Pours a hazy orange with almost no head. Aroma has key lime, pear, green apples, spices, slight lactic. Tasty is sour, more coriander, spicy, herbal, juicy fruity. Average to low carbonation and an oily body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can. Pours hazy yellow with a small fuzzy white head. Aromas of coriander, salt, citrus, lemon, lime peel, floral, lactic. Taste has lots of coriander, lemon juice, lime, salt, lactic tartness, floral.
Very pale, with quickly dying white head. Light body and sharp enough to be interesting in the mouth. Lime, ground coriander, sour acidic fruit, subtle trace of salt. DoesnÂ’t beat a real KLP!

Draft, at FOB, in Rimini, Italy. Color is pale blonde, with limited white foam. Aroma reminds of sour beers, plus some citrus. Body is medium. Taste has a strong influence of lime, with quite some acidity. Saltines is also relevant. Palate is enjoyable, with a good dryness. Still, not what I dream of drinking.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

UPDATED: OCT 29, 2016 Hazy, golden colour, no head, high carbonation. Aroma: citric acid, lime, cinnamonn, corrainder. Heavy to medium sourness, Lots of lime in flavour, some corrainder and slight salt on finish.

Big punch of lime in nose, some lactic notes as well. Pours hazy yellow with unstable white foam. Taste is sour, very straightforward with lime juice flavor. No bitterness. Overall very good, extremely refreshing. More like Berliner Weisse than Gose.
Can @ home, From Mikkeller. Light hazu golden pour with a small head that quickly vanishes. Notes of lime juice, citrus, grainy, light salt and some light lactic notes.
Puszka. Aromat bardzo limonkowy, czuÄ‡ teÅ¼ kwas mlekowy. W smaku kwaÅ›ne niskie do Å›redniego, ogrom cytrusÃ³w i mega orzeÅºwienie.

Canned. Pours slightly hazy pale golden. Aroma of citrus, lime zest and herbal notes. Slightly sweet flavor that ends up dry and a little bitter with some salt too. Light bodied, watery to oily texture and soft carbonation. A very nice Gose. ðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸ
tap/chmielarnia. jasnoÅ¼Ã³Å‚te, klarowne, niewielka biaÅ‚a piana. w aromacie zgodnie z opisem - wszystkie wariacje z cytrynÄ… w roli gÅ‚Ã³wnej, po ogrzaniu lekkie biszkopty, ciasteczka. kwaÅ›ne

Can. Pours slightly hazy golden yellow with a white head. Aroma of herbs, spices, cinnamon, lime, citrus and orange. The taste is spicy and citrussy, with notes of cinnamon, basil, herbs, lime, salt, lactic tartness and sweet bready notes.

Barwa bladoÅ¼Ã³Å‚ta, piana niska, biaÅ‚a, piwo nieprzejrzyste. Intensywny aromat kwaskowaty, limonka pojawia siÄ™ dopiero gdzieÅ› na dalszym planie. W smaku w pierwszej chwili rzuca siÄ™ woda po kiszonych ogÃ³rkach, ale potem przechodzi w limonkowÄ… kwaskowoÅ›Ä‡, ktÃ³ra jest na caÅ‚kiem wysokim poziomie.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Rami Rami is drinking a Key Lime Pie Gose by Westbrook Brewing Co. at Chmielarnia MarszaÅ‚kowskaFaktycznie zgadza sie z nazwa. Troche :)Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).
Pours a pale golden yellow color with a white head. Lemon, lime, tart and wheat aroma and flavors. On the sweeter side. Light body and average carbonation. Lime, tart and wheat finish.

Keg at Craft 100, 06/10/16.
Haze orange golden with a decent of white head that retains well.
Nose is big on lime juice, floral tones, damp straw.
Taste once again is dominated by the green citric juan, sweet lime cordials, sweet and sour effect, balsa wood, straw, light grains, lemon drizzle, Lime opal fruits.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Ok Gose, gets the Lime message across big time, just a touch too sweet for my liking.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Can from Mother Kellys Bottle Shop, Homerton, consumed on site Saturday 8th October 2016 in the company of AngÂ’ & Â’Aris.   This does exactly what it says on the can, hazy light gold thin white rim. This is creamy, tangy and fruity with lots of lime, fab fruity aroma, fab taste.  A7 A4 T8 P4 Ov15 3.8
Can at home. Pours hazy golden orange, nose is lime, biscuity, salty, taste is tart, salty, zesty lime, toffee.

Can at Star Bar. I dunno about this one. ItÂ’s very similar to a soda. Flavors of faint pie crust and with very prominent lime which is killing the beer vibe. I canÂ’t say that itÂ’s gross and itÂ’s definitely not flawed, but itÂ’s not beery enough for me. IÂ’ll take their regular gose, please.
Draft. A hazy golden beer with a white head. The aroma has notes of straw, malt, and limes. The flavor is acidic with notes of lime and wheat, leading to a tart finish.

From a can. Pours opaque gold with a fizzy white head. Tastes like lime, ginger, tart lemon, and salty cracker malt. Light body and low/medium carbonation. Smells like lime, lemon, ginger, and salty cracker malt.
Can. Cloudy yellow color, large white head. Nice aroma of key lime pie, holy cow. Taste is lightly earthy lime. Tasty and refreshing.

Draught at Fermentoren, Copenhagen. Clear pale golden beer with a decent offwhite head. Fresh lime aroma, grape fruit, pine, salty notes. Lime flavor, slightly spicy, salty, peach, some passion fruit. Really refreshing.
From tap at Fermentoren. Hazy yellow colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of acidic, lime, fruit, sourness and yeast.

Can thanks to Adrian. Nose is huge line and cracker. Light vanilla. Smells just like a tart key lime pie. Wowsers. Fairly clear, pale gold with minimal white head. Taste is initially tart, clean, lactic sourness. Pleasant line flavors come out very well after you acclimate to the sourness. Light cracker malt flavors in the finish. Very nice.

12 fl oz can at home in Richmond, as Â’Westbrook Key Lime Pie GoseÂ’, 4%, 2 months old. Golden vibrant orange, hazy, very little head. Aroma is airy with some biscuit, ginger beer, cheesecake, light lime radler vibes. Body is quite light, tingly carbonation, smooth, tooth coating. Taste is biscuity malt, lime oil, tart tangy under-ripe berry, lemon radler. Intense sour sweets with XXX written on the packet.  Nice balance between the different aspects, and an intense flavour for the ABV.  Ramped up sourness in comparison to most in the style.  Took me ages to drink a glass of this.

Can from The Beerhive. Hazy pale golden body with a thin white head that quickly fades. Steady carbonation. No lacing. Aroma of lime and green apple. Flavour of freshly squeezed lime with a salty edge. Thin body with a spritzy texture. Very fizzy. Juicy and refreshing.

Can from BrewDog Soho. It pours cloudy bright gold with a thick white head. The aroma is sweet, juicy, tangy, loads of lime, creamy, key lime pie, lemon curd and limeade. The taste is crisp, big biting tartness (in a good way), mouth - pucker, sour lime, limeade, sherbet, lactic, creamy, tangy lime marmalade, key lime pie and a touch of acidity with a dry finish. Good length of finish. Light - medium body and moderate carbonation. I love the regular version, so unsurprisingly love this. Delicious!

Draught @ Mikkeller & Friends. Hazy golden with a dense white one finger head. Fresh lime aroma with sugary notes. Reminds me a lot of a soda of sorts. Flavour is tart and refreshing with the same sugary elements adding sweetness to the finish. Not like anything, IÂ’ve had before and reslly a great experience.

Can thanks to Travis. Aroma is lime, citrus, salty, wheat, fresh squeezed lime mostly. Appearance is golden, white head, hazy. Taste is fantastic, perfect balance of lime citrus, salt, wheat, perfectly balanced and incredibly good. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, light crisp carbonation, salty lime wheat aftertaste. Overall, this is incredible.

Keg at Mother KellyÂ’s, London. It pours a clean pale straw color with a small white head. Aroma is tangy lemon and light lime and grass. Taste is also tangy acidic with lemon juice, grass, lime, straw, yoghurt. Light bodied with good carbonation. Overall, nice juan

Keg at Mother KellyÂ’s - Bethnal Green. Pours hazy yellow-gold with a creamy, white head. The nose holds salted lemon, wheat flakes. Light sweet flavour with mild acidity, lemon juice, salt, lemon peel. Light bodied with soritzy carbonation. Clean finish, tart and refreshing, quick salt and zesty lemon. Nice.
Can. Pours hazy ochre yellow with small frothy whitish head, citrus aroma, salty citrusy taste, high carbonation, abrupt finish with citrus aftertaste. Very refreshing and interesting brew.

Pours hazy pale yellow with low white head. Aroma of lime, vanilla, salt, lemon curd, cookie dough. Taste is rich sour initially followed by a sweet lime and then a cookie dough finish. Light and crisp body with average carbonation. ItÂ’s like drinking a key lime pie!

Pours hazy citrus with low white head 
Aromas tart of lime lemonade 
Taste has tart notes of lime margarita , lemon grass, grass

Pours hazy lime with a low white head. Aromas of lime, vanilla, cookie dough, sour notes. Taste is quite sour and very fruity with no bitterness. Mouthfeel is very dry and tart with medium carbonation.

Can. Pours hazy golden straw, large white head, dissipates fairly slowly with good lacing. Aroma is huge key lime, light sea air. Flavor follows, medium lime citric tart, quite light on the salt. Light body. Very drinkable, but the lime is a bit too prominent, robbing the beer of complexity.

From tap. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is citric and smooth fruity. Dry, spiced and citric. Dry and herbal far finish. Dry, citric and spiced far finish. Citric and dry. Lingering dryand citric far finish.
Hazy yellow pour. Nose is lime, cracker, salt, acidic. Taste is tart lime, salty cracker, lemon-lime.
Can. Pours a hazy yellow golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity weak sour salty lime aroma. Fruity sour tart lime flavor with weak salty hints. Has a fruity sour tart lime finish.

Soft straw blonde pour with a quickly fading white head. Nose is tart with cracker notes and brad. Subtle lime and salt as well. Salty and sour, more lime in the flavor. Light, crisp, and tart. Nice but the adjuncts make it less sessionable.

Can. Pours hazy light gold, thin white head. Aroma is lime zest, hay, kiwi, salt, citrus, grass, cream. Flavor is tart key lime, sea salt, grass, sweet cream, grain, hay. Super tart, salty but sweet lime festival in my mouth. Cool stuff.

Can [emailÂ protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Copenhagen - fuzzy golden yellow pour with white head. Aroma and taste is tart fruity with a prominent yet balanced citric zesty lime hit, lime peel, citrus fruity with some lemon, medium acidic, nice touch of salt, gorgeous stuff, well worth its style top 50 placing currently.

Can. Pours hazy yellow with off white head. Aroma is salty sour lime. Taste is sour lime with a salty mouthful. Finish is bitter lime. Pretty good but not sure it lived up to the hype and effort to obtain. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Have not had the base but IÂ’m a fan of this. Even looks like key lime. Aroma and flavor are adequately tart, and the aftertaste has a hint of crust and spices on top of tart like and salt. This could have easily been soda like, but they did a nice job.

UPDATED: JUN 11, 2017 12 oz. can from seeswo - thanks, Chris! Pours a hazy gold color with a small white head that settles into a ring. Very, very key lime-forward, with explosive lime citrus in the aroma and flavor. ThereÂ’s some grassy and herbal character, and the thing really shows some key lime pie crust and sweetness as it warms. Light-bodied, with moderate to medium carbonation and a tart, sweet, sharp mouthfeel. Really fun and unique, although it would be a bit much to have a whole pint of this. Re-rate: bumping the rating. This is crushable.
On tap at brewery. Pours a cloudy yellow with white head. Aroma of mild tartness and citrus. Taste s not as tart as the normal gose, more citrus. light bodied. Good beer for a hot day by the pool.

can from Highcraft Beer Market Cary NC. canÂ’t make out date on can. good aroma, fruity salty. nice lime, get a toasted light malt, giving the pie crust and classic gose saltiness. tad hazed golden orange color, no head or lace. medium sour flavor, medium body, smooth, still, creamy mouthfeel, salty sour finish. thatÂ’s nice, like the flavor and finish, aroma was better straight from the can, in the glass seemed to spread out the fruity aspect, good stuff
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text: Can. Hazy yellow with a foamy white head that lasts in a ring and laces. Aromas of limes, lots of lime, pie crust, light yeast, straw, wheat and spice. Flavor is tart limes and bright key limes in the front, light pie crust, wheat, spice and salt. Light bodied, crisp and dry. Moderate carbonation. Smells and taste similar to a lime-aid soda.
12 ounce can poured into a snifter. Aroma has limes, graham cracker crust, whipped cream. Juicy key limes and whipped cream. Really enjoying the crusty notes. Medium body and medium carbonation.

Can at Himmeriget. Pours a clearish pale yellow with a small diminishing white head. Smells of lime with hints of coriander. Tart and sweet. Aromas of lime and pie crust with creamy notes - all of which brings me back to the Keys. Also notes of coriander. Medium to light bodied. Medium to soft carbonation. Dry and tart finish. Also gave me a mojito burb.

Can at Himmeriget.
Hazy golden colored with a small white head.
Fruity and light acidic aroma of lime peel and spices.
Fruity and light acidic flavor of lime peel.
Tart finish.
Deep straw yellow. Nose is lime zest. Taste is sour, tart lime with some lime salt. More sour/tart than the regular. Lots of lime.

Can. Hazy yellow. Lots of lime flavor, good kick of sour. This drinks closer to an American sour than a gose. Compared to regular Westbrook gose a touch more sour. Less salt and line instead of lemon.
12 ounce shared can. Pours a hazy pale gold with a small white head. Aroma of citrus, salt, and malt. Taste is lime, lemon, salt, and malt. Very refreshing.

UPDATED: AUG 18, 2016 7/11/16 can thanks to Trevor. Pours a cloudy pale orange color with a slight white head. Nose is lime and coriander. Heavy lime, sea salt flavor with a touch of green apple. Light mouthfeel long salty finish. The lime juice is similar to what you would get from the green plastic bottles in a grocery store. Maybe has to due with can freshness?

UPDATED: SEP 11, 2016 Fresh lime juice aroma, the salt is there. Taste is highly tart from the lime with some salt which just can’t balance out the over powering key lime onslaught. Interesting to try but a little let down that this one has no balance. Overly tart which makes it tough to drink. Without the Westbrook name Im pretty sure this beer would get a much lower rating.
12oz can thanks to rich. Pours out a hazy straw topped with a small head. Nose is a nice lime lemon zest salty and some sweetness. Taste is more of the nice lime salty notes and a tart pucker.

I love westbrook gose and i love lime so this is a match made in heaven. Aroma is lime zest, cracker, wheat, and a light spice. Taste is tons of tart citrus and mild sweetness. Overall refreshing and good.
12 ounce can thanks to Dion. Lime/lemon aroma is strong. That tart salty taste from the other gose, but now with you guessed it key limes.

Aroma: Lemons, Lime Rind...
Appearance: Murky Golden Straw Hue, Passes Some Light, Thin White Head Ring, Minimal Lacing...
Taste: Limes, Hay, Mild Salt..as it lingers, it actually tastes like a key lime pie...
Mouthfeel: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Tart
Refrigerated 12 oz. aluminum can poured into a snifter. Hazy golden with no head. Aroma is tart lime, light body, lower carbonation, and little lacing. Taste is tart lime and salt. Really nice.

Poured from a 12 oz can. 
Aroma is rather key lime forward with moderate acidity. Some light wheat and grain notes with a bit of other citrus notes. 
Pours a hazy, pale, dull straw color with a medium sized, thick white head that recedes quickly to the edges and disappears. No lacing or legs. 
Flavor is moderately acidic with a touch of sweetness. Medium large to large key lime notes with some light citrus notes. Light grain character. Low bitterness and a light salt note. 
Mouthfeel is medium light bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a nice gose with a ton of key lime character. The key lime character may be overwhelming the base beer a bit, but its very drinkable.

From notes. Had this one at DougÂ’s house on August 1. 12 oz can. The pour is a cloudy golden yellow with a thicker white head that fizzles away pretty quickly. The aroma is definitely good. There is a lot of lime, and a heavy salt. ItÂ’s crazy, but there is a little cracker in there, because this smells just like a damn salty key lime pie. Holy hell. The flavor is even better. The salt is a little more reserved, and it allows this to really taste like the namesake pie. The limes are huge, and thereÂ’s a subtle sweetness to it. The crust is prominent and discernible. This is great. The mouth feel is a little heavy, but itÂ’s crisp and very effervescent. The aftertaste is sweet, and then the salt roars back. This is absolutely crushable and delicious. Holy shit.
Can shared by a friend. Opaque orange pour with a thin off-white head. Aroma of tropical fruit, funk, lime and malt. Malt and funk flavor with fresh and bright lime juice before a sour finish.

Can at RyanÂ’s, pours cloudy golden with small head. Nose of windex, and shaving cream. Flavor is weird spice, windex, lemongrass, sale and mismanaged funk. No graham or vanilla to make it a true key lime. Just chemical tasting lime

Pours a hazy golden yellow from the can with fluffy white head that dissipates to leave light lace. Aroma of sweet citrus, lactic acidity, and funk earth. Taste follows, o not really key lime to me, yes some sweet citrus, and wheat maybe lends to pie, but both are a stretch for me. Solid nonetheless.

(12oz can) cloudy light gold, fine white bubbles. Nose of lime, bright citrus, touch salt, sour. Taste is even better, lightly salty, key lime, medium tartness but not sour per se, easy to drink. Super crushable.
Can. Super light yellow, tan head. Light lime, key lime, sour, salty aromas. Key lime pie, light sour, salty and sweetness.
Can - pours yellow white head - nose/taste of key lime, pie crust, sea salt, sour lactose and light funk - lighter medium body

Can at As Is NYC. Pours a deep orange body with no lacing. Nose is pure lactic funk, vanilla yogurt and lime. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with notes of sour limeade, key lime pie and bread crust. Amazing variation of one of my favourite Goses.
Can thanks to Rainer. Pours a cloudy yellow with small white head that lasts. The aroma is salt, lime zest, mineral. Thin mouth, lime zest, sea salt, nice tartness, very good.
12oz can. If you like limes / key lime pie, this is spot on. Poured a hazy golden color with a white head. Key lime pie with the gose saltiness in the tastes and some wheat.

Can, thanks to Roger. Cloudy yellow pour, short-lived head. An odd syrupy-lime sweet-sour combo that doesnÂ’t gel at all for me. Like, on the one hand itÂ’s got a bizarro simple-sugar syrup infused with lime thing intertwined with stinky feet. Maybe separately these two aspects would work, but put together and it married the worst of both worlds. Hell, I know these folks can brew and their gose is appropriately famous, but this one misses the mark. One thing IÂ’m looking for in a beer is an ability to finish a glass. Between the two us, my wife and I managed to choke down at most 3 ounces before admitting defeat. I canÂ’t say I enjoyed anything at all about it beyond opening the can and pouring it into the glass.

Poured a hazy golden to orange color with a white head. Aroma was of fresh cut limes, crust, brine, grain. Flavor similar, bright lime character, bit still get the base gose, almost like a lemon lime beer but not fake or sweet at all. Awesome.
Cloudy gold pour with a white head. Aorima is lime, yogurt, wheat, and salt water. Taste is strong key lime, graham cracker, and light salt. Light body. Tart and refreshing.

Bottle. Hazy dull yellow/orange. Small head which quickly disappears. odor very much like the taste- tart lime with just enough salt to keep it on style. Would almost like it to be a bit sweeter to get more of the pie flavor, but still a really solid Gose.

Crowler from the source. A little sweet. A little tart. A little salty. Working together really well. A little too much key lime bitter to be super crushable radler style but still really entertaining.
Really awesome gose. Nice tart lime body, some graham cracker, creamy body, I'll by the pie aspect. Not much saltiness, but really drinkable and tasty.

4 oz taster draft as part of a 4 beer flight at the Westbrook Brewing Company in Mount Pleasant, South Carolina. The pour is a golden yellow with a minimal white head. The aroma is lime citrus with a bit of graham cracker sweet and general sour citrus. The taste is smooth flavors of lime citrus, tart, the graham cracker pie crust and some cinnamon in the finish. The palate is light bodied with active carbonation and a tart key lime pie finish. Beautifully executed, truly the beer representation of Key Lime Pie, which I love.

UPDATED: SEP 13, 2016 Slight sour aroma with some lime. Taste is very sour and full bodied for a gose. Prob more sour then the normal Westbrook gose and maybe slightly more salty, but with great lime finish. Give a sweet tart feel. Really fantastic.  Even has a bit of a graham cracker finish. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
